alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 10:32AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Arapahoe, southwestern Denver and northeastern Jefferson Counties through 1100 AM MDT... At 1032 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tiny Town, or 16 miles southwest of Denver, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Denver, Lakewood, Littleton, Englewood, Greenwood Village, Sheridan, Morrison, Tiny Town, Red Rocks Park and Indian Hills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
